description: This course takes a case-study approach to the fitting and assessment of statistical models with application to real data. Specific topics include two-sample comparisons, simple linear regression, multiple regression, model diagnostics, logistic regression for focus on problem-solving tools, interpretation, mathematical models underlying analysis methods, and written statistical reports. Prerequisite: Statistics 110 or 212 or 263, or permission of instructor. Offered Fall and Spring Semesters.
name: Statistical Modeling
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Statistics 110 or 212 or 263, or permission of instructor. Offered Fall and Spring Semesters.
